Function.Description: The *= macro multiplies the target argument by the value of the source argument.

Brief.Overview: The *= macro multiplies the target argument by the value of the source argument.
Brief.Usage:
The *= Macro is equivalent to the following Lisp expression:

(setq target (* target source))

Argument.Name: source
Argument.Note: The symbol or constant that contains the value that will be used as the multiplier.

Syntax.Return: Returns the result of the multiply operation.
